titleStmt.title: Diaphanta, or, Three attendants on Fiat lux wherein Catholick religion is further excused against the opposition of severall adversaries ... and by the way an answer is given to Mr. Moulin, Denton, and Stillingfleet.
Diaphanta
titleStmt.author: J. V. C. (John Vincent Canes), d. 1672.

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of original in Union Theological Seminary Library, New York.
Attributed to John Vincent Canes. cf. NUC pre-1956.
Published in 1671 under title: Three letters declaring the strange odd proceedings of Protestant divines, when they write against Catholicks.
(from t.p.) I. Epistola ad odoenum, against Dr. Owen -- II. Epistola and croesum, against Mr. Whitby -- III. Epistola ad ampibolum, against Dr. Taylor.
